verses.text: And if with the expectation wherewith thou dost expect the day of the Mighty One thou art so overcome, what (wilt thou be) when thou shalt come to its advent?

verses.name: Second Baruch 55:7
verses.text: And, if at the word of the announcement of the torment of those who have done foolishly thou art so wholly distraught, how much more when the event will reveal marvellous things?

verses.name: Second Baruch 55:8
verses.text: And if thou hast heard tidings of the good and evil things which are then coming and art grieved, what (wilt thou be) when thou shalt behold what the majesty will reveal, which shall convict these and cause those to rejoice?

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:1
verses.text: Nevertheless, because thou hast besought the Most High to reveal to thee the interpretation of the vision which thou hast seen, I have been sent to tell thee.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:2
verses.text: And the Mighty One hath assuredly made known to thee the methods of the times that have passed, and of those that are destined to pass in His world from the beginning of its creations even unto its consummation, of those things which (are) deceit and of those which (are) in truth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:3
verses.text: For as thou didst see a great cloud which ascended from the sea, and went and covered the earth, this is the duration of the world which the Mighty One made when he took counsel to make the world.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:4
verses.text: And it came to pass when the word had gone forth from His presence, that the duration of the world had come into being in a small degree, and was established according to the multitude of the intelligence of Him who sent it.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:5
verses.text: And as thou didst previously see on the summit of the cloud black waters which descended previously on the earth, this is the transgression wherewith Adam the first man transgressed.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:6
verses.text: For owing to his transgression untimely death came into being, and grief was named and anguish was prepared, and pain was created, and trouble perfected, And boasting began to be established, And Sheol to demand that it should be renewed in blood, and the begetting of children was brought about, and the passion of parents produced, and the greatness of humanity was humiliated, and goodness languished.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:7
verses.text: What therefore can be blacker or darker than these things?

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:8
verses.text: This is the beginning of the black waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:9
verses.text: And from these black (waters) again were black derived, and the darkness of darkness was produced.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:10
verses.text: For he was a danger to his own soul: even to the angels was he a danger.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:11
verses.text: For, moreover, at that time when he was created, they enjoyed liberty.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:12
verses.text: And some of them descended, and mingled with the women.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:13
verses.text: And then those who did so were tormented in chains.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:14
verses.text: But the rest of the multitude of the angels, of which there is no number, restrained themselves.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:15
verses.text: And those who dwelt on the earth perished together (with them) through the waters of the deluge.

verses.name: Second Baruch 56:16
verses.text: These are the black first waters.

verses.name: Second Baruch 57:1
verses.text: "And after these (waters) thou didst see bright waters: this is the fount of Abraham, also his generations and advent of his son, and of his son's son, and of those like them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 57:2
verses.text: Because at that time the unwritten law was named amongst them, and the works of the commandments were then fulfilled, and belief in the coming judgement was then generated, and hope of the world that was to be renewed was then built up, and the promise of the life that should come hereafter was implanted.

verses.name: Second Baruch 57:3
verses.text: These are the bright waters, which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 58:1
verses.text: "And the black third waters which thou hast seen, these are the mingling of all sins, which the nations afterwards wrought after the death of those righteous men, and the wickedness of the land of Egypt, wherein they did wickedly in the service wherewith they made their sons to serve.

verses.name: Second Baruch 58:2
verses.text: Nevertheless, these also perished at last.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:1
verses.text: "And the bright fourth waters which thou hast seen are the advent of Moses and Aaron and Miriam and Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb and of all those like them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:2
verses.text: For at that time the lamp of the eternal law shone on all those who sat in darkness, which announced to them that believe the promise of their reward, and to them that deny, the torment of fire which is reserved for them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:3
verses.text: But also the heavens at that time were shaken from their place, and those who were under the throne of the Mighty One were perturbed, when He was taking Moses unto Himself.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:4
verses.text: For He showed him many admonitions together with the principles of the law and the consummation of time, as also to thee, and likewise the pattern of Zion and its measures, which was made to be in the pattern of the sanctuary of the present time.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:5
verses.text: But then also He showed to him the measures of the fire, also the depths of the abyss, and the weight of the winds, and the number of the drops of rain.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:6
verses.text: And the suppression of anger, and the multitude of long-suffering, and the truth of judgement.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:7
verses.text: And the root of wisdom, and the riches of understanding, and the fount of knowledge.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:8
verses.text: And the height of the air, and the greatness of Paradise, and the consummation of the ages, and the beginning of the day of judgement.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:9
verses.text: And the number of the offerings, and the earths which have not yet come.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:10
verses.text: And the mouth of Gehenna, and the station of vengeance, and the place of faith, and the region of hope.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:11
verses.text: And the likeness of future torment, and the multitude of innumerable angels, and the powers of the flames, and the splendour of the lightnings, and the voice of the thunders, and the orders of the chiefs of the angels, and the treasuries of light, and the changes of the times, and the investigations of the law.

verses.name: Second Baruch 59:12
verses.text: These are the bright fourth waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 60:1
verses.text: "And the black fifth waters which thou hast seen raining are the works which the Amorites wrought, and the spells of their incantations which they wrought, and the wickedness of their mysteries, and the mingling of their pollution.

verses.name: Second Baruch 60:2
verses.text: But even Israel was then polluted by sins in the days of the judges, though they saw many signs which were from Him who made them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:1
verses.text: "And the bright sixth waters which thou didst see, this is the time in which David and Solomon were born.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:2
verses.text: And there was at that time the building of Zion, and the dedication of the sanctuary, and the shedding of much blood of the nations that sinned then, and many offerings which were offered then in the dedication of the sanctuary.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:3
verses.text: And peace and tranquillity existed at that time.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:4
verses.text: And wisdom was heard in the assembly, and the riches of understanding were magnified in the congregations.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:5
verses.text: And the holy festivals were fulfilled in goodness and in much joy.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:6
verses.text: And the judgement of the rulers was then seen to be without guile, and the righteousness of the precepts of the Mighty One was accomplished with truth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:7
verses.text: And because the land was then beloved at that time, and because its inhabitants sinned not, it was glorified beyond all lands, and the city Zion ruled then over all lands and regions.

verses.name: Second Baruch 61:8
verses.text: These are the bright waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:1
verses.text: "And the black seventh waters which thou bast seen, this is the perversion (brought about) by the counsel of Jeroboam, who took counsel to make two calves of gold.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:2
verses.text: And all the iniquities which kings who were after him iniquitously wrought.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:3
verses.text: And the curse of Jezebel and the worship of idols which Israel practised at that time.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:4
verses.text: And the withholding of rain, and the famines which occurred until women eat the fruit of their wombs.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:5
verses.text: And the time of their captivity which came upon the nine tribes and a half, because they were in many sins.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:6
verses.text: And Salmanasar king of Assyria came and led them away captive.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:7
verses.text: But regarding the Gentiles it were tedious to tell how they always wrought impiety and wickedness, and never wrought righteousness.

verses.name: Second Baruch 62:8
verses.text: These are the black seventh waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:1
verses.text: "And the bright eighth waters which thou hast seen, this is the rectitude and uprightness of Hezekiah king of Judah and the benignity which came upon him.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:2
verses.text: For when Sennacherib was stirred up in order that he might perish, and his wrath troubled him in order that he might thereby perish, for the multitude also of the nations which were with him.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:3
verses.text: When, moreover, Hezekiah the king heard those things which the king of Assyria was devising, (i.e.) to come and seize him and destroy his people, the two and a half tribes which remained: nay, more he wished to overthrow Zion also: then Hezekiah trusted in his works, and had hope in his righteousness, and spake with the Mighty One and said:

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:4
verses.text: 'Behold, for lo! Sennacherib is prepared to destroy us, and he will be boastful and uplifted when he has destroyed Zion.'

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:5
verses.text: And the Mighty One heard him, for Hezekiah was wise, And He had respect unto his prayer, because he was righteous.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:6
verses.text: And thereupon the Mighty One commanded Ramiel His angel who speaks with thee.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:7
verses.text: And I went forth and destroyed their multitude, the number of whose chiefs only was a hundred and eighty-five thousand, and each one of them had an equal number (at his command).

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:8
verses.text: And at that time I burned their bodies within, but their raiment and arms I preserved outwardly, in order that the still more wonderful deeds of the Mighty One might appear, and that thereby His name might be spoken of throughout the whole earth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:9
verses.text: Moreover, Zion was saved and Jerusalem delivered: Israel also was freed from tribulation.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:10
verses.text: And all those who were in the holy land rejoiced, and the name of the Mighty One was glorified so that it was spoken of.

verses.name: Second Baruch 63:11
verses.text: These are the bright waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:1
verses.text: "And the black ninth waters which thou hast seen, this is all the wickedness which was in the days of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:2
verses.text: For he wrought much impiety, and he slew the righteous, and he wrested judgement. and he shed the blood of the innocent, and wedded women he violently polluted, and he overturned the altars, and destroyed their offerings, and drove forth their priests lest they should minister in the sanctuary.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:3
verses.text: And he made an image with five faces: four of them looked to the four winds, and the fifth on the summit of the image as an adversary of the zeal of the Mighty One.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:4
verses.text: And then wrath went forth from the presence of the Mighty One to the intent that Zion should be rooted out, as also it befell in your days.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:5
verses.text: But also against the two tribes and a half went forth a decree that they should also be led away captive, as thou hast now seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:6
verses.text: And to such a degree did the impiety of Manasseh increase, that it removed the praise of the Most High from the sanctuary.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:7
verses.text: On this account Manasseh was at that time named "the impious", and finally his abode was in the fire.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:8
verses.text: For though his prayer was heard with the Most High, finally, when he was cast into the brazen horse and the brazen horse was melted, it served as a sign unto him at the time.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:9
verses.text: For he had not lived perfectly, for he was not worthy- but that thenceforward he might know by whom finally he should be tormented.

verses.name: Second Baruch 64:10
verses.text: For he who is able to benefit is also able to torment.

verses.name: Second Baruch 65:1
verses.text: Thus, moreover, did Manasseh act impiously, and thought that in his time the Mighty One would not inquire into these things.

verses.name: Second Baruch 65:2
verses.text: These are the black ninth waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:1
verses.text: "And the bright tenth waters which thou hast seen: this is the purity of the generations of Josiah king of Judah, who was the only one at the time who submitted himself to the Mighty One with all his heart and with all his soul.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:2
verses.text: And he cleansed the land from idols, and hallowed all the vessels which had been polluted, and restored the offerings to the altar, and raised the horn of the holy, and exalted the righteous, and honoured all that were wise in understanding, and brought back the priests to their ministry, and destroyed and removed the magicians and enchanters and fortune-tellers from the land.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:3
verses.text: And not only did he slay the impious that were living, but they also took from the sepulchres the bones of the dead and burned them with fire.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:4
verses.text: [And the festivals and the sabbaths he established in their sanctity], and their polluted ones he burnt in the fire, and the lying prophets which deceived the people, these also he burnt in the fire, and the people who listened to them when they were living, he cast them into the brook Cedron, and heaped stones upon them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:5
verses.text: And he was zealous with zeal of the Mighty One with all his soul, and he alone was firm in the law at that time, so that he left none that was uncircumcised, or that wrought impiety in all the land, all the days of his life.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:6
verses.text: This, moreover, is he that shall receive an eternal reward, and he shall be glorified with the Mighty One beyond many at a later time.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:7
verses.text: For on his account and on account of those who are like him were the inestimable glories, of which thou wast told before, created and prepared.

verses.name: Second Baruch 66:8
verses.text: These are the bright waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:1
verses.text: "And the black eleventh waters which thou hast seen: this is the calamity which is now befalling Zion.

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:2
verses.text: Dost thou think that there is no anguish to the angels in the presence of the Mighty One, that Zion was so delivered up, and that lo! the Gentiles boast in their hearts, and assemble before their idols and say, 'She is trodden down who ofttimes trod down, and she has been reduced to servitude who reduced (others)'?

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:3
verses.text: Dost thou think that in these things the Most High rejoices, Or that His name is glorified?

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:4
verses.text: But how will it serve towards His righteous judgement?

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:5
verses.text: Yet after these things shall those that are dispersed among the Gentiles be taken hold of by tribulation, and in shame shall they dwell in every place.

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:6
verses.text: Because so far as Zion is delivered up and Jerusalem laid waste, and idols prosper in the cities of the Gentiles, and the vapour of the smoke of the incense of the righteousness which is by the law is extinguished in Zion and in the region of Zion in every place lo! there is the smoke of impiety.

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:7
verses.text: But the king of Babylon will arise who has now destroyed Zion, and he will boast over the people, and he will speak great things in his heart in the presence of the Most High.

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:8
verses.text: But he also shall fall at last.

verses.name: Second Baruch 67:9
verses.text: These are the black waters.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:1
verses.text: "And the bright twelfth waters which thou hast seen: this is the word.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:2
verses.text: For after these things a time will come when thy people shall fall into distress, so that they shall all run the risk of perishing together.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:3
verses.text: Nevertheless, they will be saved, and their enemies will fall in their presence.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:4
verses.text: And they will have in (due) time much joy.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:5
verses.text: And at that time after a little interval Zion will again be builded, and its offerings will again be restored, and the priests will return to their ministry, and also the Gentiles will come to glorify it.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:6
verses.text: Nevertheless, not fully as in the beginning.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:8
verses.text: But it will come to pass after these things that there will be the fall of many nations.

verses.name: Second Baruch 68:9
verses.text: These are the bright waters which thou hast seen.

verses.name: Second Baruch 69:1
verses.text: "For the last waters which thou hast seen which were darker than all that were before them, those which were after the twelfth number, which were collected together, belong to the whole world.

verses.name: Second Baruch 69:2
verses.text: For the Most High made division from the beginning, because He alone knows what will befall.

verses.name: Second Baruch 69:3
verses.text: For as to the enormities and the impieties which should be wrought before Him, He foresaw six kinds of them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 69:4
verses.text: And of the good works of the righteous which should be accomplished before Him, He foresaw six kinds of them, beyond those which He should work at the consummation of the age.

verses.name: Second Baruch 69:5
verses.text: On his account there were not black waters with black, nor bright with bright; for it is the consummation.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:1
verses.text: 'Hear therefore the interpretation of the last black waters which are to come [after the black]: this is the word.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:2
verses.text:
Behold! the days come, and it shall be when the time of the age has ripened, and the harvest of its evil and good seeds has come, that the Mighty One will bring upon the earth and its inhabitants and upon its rulers perturbation of spirit and stupor of heart. 

*[70:3]** And they will hate one another, and provoke one another to fight, and the mean will rule over the honourable, and those of low degree shall be extolled above the famous.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:4
verses.text: And the many will be delivered into the hands of the few, and those who are nothing will rule over the strong, and the poor shall have abundance beyond the rich, and the impious will exalt themselves above the heroic.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:5
verses.text: And the wise shall be silent, and the foolish shall speak, neither will the thought of men be then confirmed, nor the counsel of the mighty, nor shall the hope of those who hope be confirmed.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:6
verses.text: Moreover, it will be when those things which were predicted have come to pass, that confusion will fall upon all men, and some of them will fall in battle, and some of them will perish in anguish, and some of them will be destroyed by their own.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:7
verses.text: Then the Most High will reveal those peoples whom He has prepared before, and they will come and make war with the leaders that shall then be left.

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:8
verses.text:
And it will come to pass that whosoever gets safe out of the war will die in the earthquake, and whosoever gets safe out of the earthquake will be burned by the fire, and whosoever gets safe out of the fire will be destroyed by famine.

[

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:9
verses.text: And it shall come to pass that whosoever of the victors and the vanquished gets safe out of and escapes all these things aforesaid will be delivered into the hands of My servant Messiah.]

verses.name: Second Baruch 70:10
verses.text: For all the earth will devour its inhabitants.

verses.name: Second Baruch 71:1
verses.text: "And the holy land will have mercy on its own, and it will protect its inhabiters at that time.

verses.name: Second Baruch 71:2
verses.text: This is the vision which thou hast seen, and this is the interpretation.

verses.name: Second Baruch 71:3
verses.text: For I have come to tell thee these things, because thy prayer has been heard with the Most High.

verses.name: Second Baruch 72:1
verses.text: "Hear now also regarding the bright lightning which is to come at the consummation after these black (waters): this is the word.

verses.name: Second Baruch 72:2
verses.text: After the signs have come, of which thou wast told before, when the nations become turbulent, and the time of My Messiah is come, He will both summon all the nations, and some of them He will spare, and some of them He will slay.

verses.name: Second Baruch 72:3
verses.text: These things therefore shall come upon the nations which are to be spared by Him.

verses.name: Second Baruch 72:4
verses.text: Every nation, which knows not Israel and has not trodden down the seed of Jacob, shall indeed be spared.

verses.name: Second Baruch 72:5
verses.text: And this because some out of every nation shall be subjected to thy people.

verses.name: Second Baruch 72:6
verses.text: But all those who have ruled over you, or have known you, shall be given up to the sword.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:1
verses.text: "And it will come to pass, when He has brought low everything that is in the world, and has sat down in peace for the age on the throne of His kingdom, that joy shall then be revealed, and rest appear.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:2
verses.text: And then healing will descend in dew, and disease will withdraw, and anxiety and anguish and lamentation will pass from amongst men, and gladness proceed through the whole earth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:3
verses.text: And no one shall again die untimely, nor shall any adversity suddenly befall.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:4
verses.text: And judgements, and revilings, and contentions, and revenges, and blood, and passions, and envy, and hatred, and whatsoever things are like these shall go into condemnation when they are removed.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:5
verses.text: For it is these very things which have filled this world with evils, and on account of these the life of man has been greatly troubled.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:6
verses.text: And wild beasts will come from the forest and minister unto men, and asps and dragons will come forth from their holes to submit themselves to a little child.

verses.name: Second Baruch 73:7
verses.text: And women shall no longer then have pain when they bear, nor will they suffer torment when they yield the fruit of the womb.

verses.name: Second Baruch 74:1
verses.text: And it will come to pass in those days that the reapers will not grow weary, nor those that build be toilworn; for the works will of themselves speedily advance with those who do them in much tranquillity.

verses.name: Second Baruch 74:2
verses.text: For that time is the consummation of that which is corruptible, and the beginning of that which is not corruptible.

verses.name: Second Baruch 74:3
verses.text: Therefore those things which were predicted will belong to it: therefore it is far away from evils, and near to those things which die not.

verses.name: Second Baruch 74:4
verses.text: This is the bright lightning which came after the last dark waters."

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:1
verses.text: And I answered and said: "Who can understand, O Lord, Thy goodness? For it is incomprehensible.

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:2
verses.text: Or who can search into thy compassions, which are infinite?

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:3
verses.text: Or who can comprehend Thy intelligence?

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:4
verses.text: Or who is able to recount the thoughts of Thy mind?

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:5
verses.text: Or who of those who are born can hope to come to those things, unless he is one to whom Thou art merciful and gracious?

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:6
verses.text: Because, if assuredly Thou didst not have compassion on man, those who are under Thy right hand, they could not come to those things, but those who are in the numbers named can be called.

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:7
verses.text: But if, indeed, we who exist know wherefore we have come, and submit ourselves to Him who brought us out of Egypt, we shall come again and remember those things which have passed, and shall rejoice regarding that which has been.

verses.name: Second Baruch 75:8
verses.text: But if now we know not wherefore we have come, and recognise not the principate of Him who brought us up out of Egypt, we shall come again and seek after those things which were now, and be grieved with pain because of those things which have befallen."

verses.name: Second Baruch 76:1
verses.text: And He answered and said unto me: ["Inasmuch as the revelation of this vision has been interpreted to thee as thou besoughtest], hear the word of the Most High that thou mayest know what is to befall thee after these things.

verses.name: Second Baruch 76:2
verses.text: For thou shalt surely depart from this earth, nevertheless not unto death but thou shalt be preserved unto the consummation of the times.

verses.name: Second Baruch 76:3
verses.text: Go up therefore to the top of that mountain, and there will pass before thee all the regions of that land, and the figure of the inhabited world, and the top of the mountains, and the depth of the valleys, and the depths of the seas, and the number of the rivers, that thou mayest see what thou art leaving and whither thou art going.

verses.name: Second Baruch 76:4
verses.text: Now this will befall after forty days.

verses.name: Second Baruch 76:5
verses.text: Go now therefore during these days and instruct the people so far as thou art able, that they may learn so as not to die at the last time, but may learn in order that they may live at the last times."

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:1
verses.text: And I, Baruch, went thence and came to the people, and assembled them together from the greatest to the least, and said unto them:

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:2
verses.text: "Hear, ye children of Israel, behold how many ye are who remain of the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:3
verses.text: For to you and to your fathers the Lord gave a law beyond peoples.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:4
verses.text: And because your brethren transgressed the commandments of the Most High, He brought vengeance upon you and upon them, and He spared not the former, and the latter also He gave into captivity, and left not a residue of them,

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:5
verses.text: But behold! ye are here with me.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:6
verses.text: If, therefore, ye direct your ways aright, ye also shall not depart as your brethren departed, but they will come to you.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:7
verses.text: For He is merciful whom ye worship, and He is gracious in whom ye hope, and He is true, so that He shall do (you) good and not evil.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:8
verses.text: Lo! have ye not seen here what has befallen Zion?

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:9
verses.text: Or do ye perchance think that the place had sinned, and that on this account it was overthrown, or that the land had wrought foolishness, and that therefore it was delivered up?

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:10
verses.text: And know ye not that on account of you who did sin, that which sinned not was overthrown, and, on account of those who wrought wickedly, that which wrought not foolishness was delivered up to (its) enemies."

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:11
verses.text: And the whole people answered and said unto me: "So far as we can recall the good things which the Mighty One has done unto us, we do recall them; and those things which we do not remember He in His mercy knows.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:12
verses.text: Nevertheless, do this for us thy people: write also to our brethren in Babylon an epistle of doctrine and a scroll of good tidings, that thou mayest confirm them also before thou dost depart from us.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:13
verses.text: For the shepherds of Israel have perished, and the lamps which gave light are extinguished, and the fountains have withheld their stream whence we used to drink.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:14
verses.text: And we are left in the darkness, and amid the trees of the forest, and the thirst of the wilderness."

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:15
verses.text: And I answered and said unto them: "Shepherds and lamps and fountains came (to us) from the law: and though we depart, yet the law abideth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:16
verses.text: If therefore ye have respect to the law, and are intent upon wisdom, a lamp will not be wanting, and a shepherd will not fail, and a fountain will not dry up.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:17
verses.text: Nevertheless, as ye said unto me, I will write also unto your brethren in Babylon, and I will send by means of men, and I will write in like manner to the nine tribes and a half, and send by means of a bird."

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:18
verses.text: And it came to pass on the one and twentieth day in the eighth month that I, Baruch, came and sat down under the oak under the shadow of the branches, and no man was with me, but I was alone.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:19
verses.text: And I wrote these two epistles: one I sent by an eagle to the nine and a half tribes; and the other I sent to those that were at Babylon by means of three men.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:20
verses.text: And I called the eagle and spake these words unto it:

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:21
verses.text: "The Most High hath made thee that thou shouldst be higher than all birds.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:22
verses.text: And now go and tarry not in (any) place, nor enter a nest, nor settle upon any tree, till thou hast passed over the breadth of the many waters of the river Euphrates, and hast gone to the people that dwell there, and cast down to them this epistle.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:23
verses.text: Remember, moreover, that, at the time of the deluge, Noah received from a dove the fruit of the olive, when he sent it forth from the ark.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:24
verses.text: Yea, also the ravens ministered to Elijah, bearing him food, as they had been commanded. Solomon also, in the time of his kingdom, whithersoever he wished to send or seek for anything, commanded a bird (to go thither), and it obeyed him as he commanded it.

verses.name: Second Baruch 77:25
verses.text: And now let it not weary thee, and turn not to the right hand nor the left, but fly and go by a direct way, that thou mayst preserve the command of the Mighty One, according as I said unto thee."

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:1
verses.text: These are the words of that epistle which Baruch the son of Neriah sent to the nine and a half tribes, which were across the river Euphrates, in which these things were written.

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:2
verses.text: Thus saith Baruch the son of Neriah to the brethren carried into captivity:

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:3
verses.text: "Mercy and peace." I bear in mind, my brethren, the love of Him who created us, who loved us from of old, and never hated us, but above all educated us.

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:4
verses.text: And truly I know that behold all we the twelve tribes are bound by one bond, inasmuch as we are born from one father.

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:5
verses.text: Wherefore I have been the more careful to leave you the words of this epistle before I die, that ye may be comforted regarding the evils which have come upon you, and that ye may be grieved also regarding the evil that has befallen your brethren; and again, also, that ye may justify His judgement which He has decreed against you that ye should be carried away captives- for what ye have suffered is disproportioned to what ye have done- in order that, at the last times, ye may be found worthy of your fathers.

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:6
verses.text: Therefore, if ye consider those things which ye have now suffered for your good, that ye may not finally be condemned and tormented, then ye will receive eternal hope; if above all ye destroy from your heart vain error, on account of which ye departed hence.

verses.name: Second Baruch 78:7
verses.text: For if ye so do these things, He will continually remember you, He who alway promised on our behalf to those who were more excellent than we, that He will never forget or forsake us, but with much mercy will gather together again those who were dispersed.

verses.name: Second Baruch 79:1
verses.text: Now, my brethren, learn first what befell Zion: how that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against us.

verses.name: Second Baruch 79:2
verses.text: For we have sinned against Him who made us, and we have not kept the commandments which he commanded us, yet he hath not chastened us as we deserved.

verses.name: Second Baruch 79:3
verses.text: For what befell you we also suffer in a pre-eminent degree, for it befell us also.

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:1
verses.text: And now, my brethren, I make known unto you that when the enemy had surrounded the city, the angels of the Most High were sent, and they overthrew the fortifications of the strong wall, and they destroyed the firm iron corners, which could not be rooted out.

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:2
verses.text: Nevertheless, they hid all the vessels of the sanctuary, lest the enemy should get possession of them.

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:3
verses.text: And when they had done these things, they delivered thereupon to the enemy the overthrown wall, and the plundered house, and the burnt temple, and the people who were overcome because they were delivered up, lest the enemy should boast and say: "Thus by force have we been able to lay waste even the house of the Most High in war."

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:4
verses.text: Your brethren also have they bound and led away to Babylon, and have caused them to dwell there.

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:5
verses.text: But we have been left here, being very few.

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:6
verses.text: This is the tribulation about which I wrote to you.

verses.name: Second Baruch 80:7
verses.text: For assuredly I know that the habitation of Zion gave you consolation : so far as ye knew that it was prospered (your consolation) was greater than the tribulation which ye endured in having to depart from it.

verses.name: Second Baruch 81:1
verses.text: But regarding consolation, hear ye the word.

verses.name: Second Baruch 81:2
verses.text: For I was mourning regarding Zion, and I prayed for mercy from the Most High, and I said:

verses.name: Second Baruch 81:3
verses.text: "How long will these things endure for us? And will these evils come upon us always?"

verses.name: Second Baruch 81:4
verses.text: And the Mighty One did according to the multitude of His mercies, and the Most High according to the greatness of His compassion, and He revealed unto me the word, that I might receive consolation, and He showed me visions that I should not again endure anguish, and He made known to me the mystery of the times, and the advent of the hours He showed me.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:1
verses.text: Therefore, my brethren, I have written to you, that ye may comfort yourselves regarding the multitude of your tribulations.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:2
verses.text: For know ye that our Maker will assuredly avenge us on all our enemies, according to all that they have done to us, also that the consummation which the Most High will make is very nigh, and His mercy that is coming, and the consummation of His judgement is by no means far off.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:3
verses.text: For lo! we see now the multitude of the prosperity of the Gentiles, though they act impiously, but they will be like a vapour:

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:4
verses.text: And we behold the multitude of their power, though they do wickedly, but they will be made like unto a drop:

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:5
verses.text: And we see the firmness of their might, though they resist the Mighty One every hour, but they will be accounted as spittle.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:6
verses.text: And we consider the glory of their greatness, though they do not keep the statutes of the Most High, but as smoke will they pass away.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:7
verses.text: And we meditate on the beauty of theirs gracefulness, though they have to do with pollutions, but as grass that withers will they fade away.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:8
verses.text: And we consider the strength of their cruelty, though they remember not the end (thereof), but as a wave that passes will they be broken.

verses.name: Second Baruch 82:9
verses.text:
And we remark the boastfulness of their might, though they deny the beneficence of God, who gave (it) to them, but they will pass away as a passing cloud.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:1
verses.text: For the Most High will assuredly hasten His times, and He will assuredly bring on His hours.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:2
verses.text: And He will assuredly judge those who are in His world, and will visit in truth all things by means of all their hidden works.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:3
verses.text: And He will assuredly examine the secret thoughts, and that which is laid up in the secret chambers of all the members of man, and will make (them) manifest in the presence of all with reproof.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:4
verses.text:
Let none therefore of these present things ascend into your hearts, but above all let us be expectant, because that which is promised to us will come.
wi

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:5
verses.text: And let us not now look unto the delights of the Gentiles in the present, but let us remember what has been promised to us in the end.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:6
verses.text: For the ends of the times and of the seasons and whatsoever is with them shall assuredly pass by.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:7
verses.text: The consummation, moreover, of the age shall then show the great might of its ruler, when all things come to judgement.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:8
verses.text: Do ye therefore prepare your hearts for that which before ye believed, lest ye come to be in bondage in both worlds, so that ye be led away captive here and be tormented there.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:9
verses.text: For that which exists now or which has passed away, or which is to come in all these things, neither is the evil fully evil, nor again the good fully good.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:10
verses.text: For all healthinesses of this time are turning into diseases.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:11
verses.text: And all might of this time is turning into weakness, and all the force of this time is turning into misery.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:12
verses.text: And every energy of youth is turning into old age and consummation, and every beauty of gracefulness of this time is turning faded and hateful.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:13
verses.text: And every proud dominion of the present is turning into humiliation and shame.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:14
verses.text: And every praise of the glory of this time is turning into the shame of silence, and every splendour and insolence of this time is turning into voiceless ruin.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:15
verses.text: And every delight and joy of this time is turning to worms and corruption.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:16
verses.text: And every clamour of the pride of this time is turning into dust and stillness.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:17
verses.text: And every possession of riches of this time is being turned into Sheol alone.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:18
verses.text: And all the rapine of passion of this time is turning into involuntary death, and every passion of the lusts of this time is turning into a judgement of torment.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:19
verses.text: And every artifice and craftiness of this time is turning into a proof of the truth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:20
verses.text: And every sweetness of unguents of this time is turning into judgement and condemnation.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:21
verses.text: And every love of lying is turning to shame through truth.

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:22
verses.text: Since therefore all these things are done now, does anyone think that they will not be avenged?

verses.name: Second Baruch 83:23
verses.text: But the consummation of all things will come to the truth.]

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:1
verses.text: Behold! I have therefore made known unto you (these things) whilst I live: for I have said that ye should above all thngs learn the commandments of the Mighty One, wherein I shall instruct you; and I will set before you some of the commandments of His judgement before I die.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:2
verses.text: Remember that formerly Moses assuredly called heaven and earth to witness against you and said: "if ye transgress the law ye shall be dispersed, but if ye keep it ye shall be kept."

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:3
verses.text: And other things also he used to say unto you when ye the twelve tribes were together in the desert.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:4
verses.text: And after his death ye cast them away from you: on this account there came upon you what had been predicted.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:5
verses.text: And now Moses used to tell you before they befell you, and lo! they have befallen you: for ye have forsaken the law.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:6
verses.text: Lo! I also say unto you after ye have suffered, that if ye obey those things which have been said unto you, ye will receive from the Mighty One whatever has been laid up and reserved for you.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:7
verses.text: Moreover, let this epistle be for a testimony between me and you, that ye may remember the commandments of the Mighty One, and that also there may be to me a defence in the presence of Him who sent me.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:8
verses.text: And remember ye the law and Zion, and the holy land and your brethren, and the covenant of your fathers, and forget not the festivals and the sabbaths.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:9
verses.text: And deliver ye this epistle and the traditions of the law to your sons after you, as also your fathers delivered (them) to you.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:10
verses.text: And at all times make request perseveringly and pray diligently with your whole heart that the Mighty One may be reconciled to you, and that He may not reckon the multitude of your sins, but remember the rectitude of your fathers.

verses.name: Second Baruch 84:11
verses.text:
For if He judge us not according to the multitude of His mercies, woe unto all us who are born.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:1
verses.text: Know ye, moreover, that in former times and in the generations of old our fathers had helpers, Righteous men and holy prophets.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:2
verses.text: Nay more, we were in our own land and they helped us when we sinned, And they prayed for us with Him who made us, because they trusted in their works, and the Mighty One heard their prayer and was gracious us.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:3
verses.text: But now the righteous have been gathered and the prophets have fallen asleep, and we also have gone forth from the land, and Zion has been taken from us, and we have nothing now save the Mighty One and His law.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:4
verses.text: If therefore we direct and dispose our hearts, we shall receive everything that we lost, and much better things than we lost (yea, better) by many times.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:5
verses.text:
For what we have lost was subject to corruption, and what we shall receive shall not be corruptible.

[

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:6
verses.text: Moreover, also, I have written thus to our brethren to Babylon, that to them also I may attest these very things.]

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:7
verses.text: And let all those things aforesaid be always before your eyes, because we are still in the spirit and the power of our liberty.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:8
verses.text: Again, moreover, the Most High also is long-suffering towards us here, and He hath shown to us that which is to be, and hath not concealed from us what will befall in the end.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:9
verses.text: Before therefore judgement exact its own, and truth that which is its due, let us prepare our soul that we may enter into possessin of, and not be taken possession of, and that we may hope and not be put to shame, and that we may rest with our fathers, and not be tormented with our enemies.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:10
verses.text: For the youth of the world is past, and the strength of the creation already exhausted, and the advent of the times is very short, yea, they have passed by; and the pitcher is near to the cistern, and the ship to the port, and the course of the journey to the city, and life to consummation.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:11
verses.text: And again prepare your souls, so that when ye sail and ascend from the ship ye may have rest and not be condemned when ye depart.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:12
verses.text: For lo! when the Most High will bring to pass all these things, there will not there be again an opportunity for returning, nor a limit to the times, or adjurmement to the hours, nor a change of ways, nor place for prayer, nor sending of petitions, nor receiving of knowledge, nor giving of love, nor place of repentance, nor supplication for offences, nor intercession of the fathers, nor prayer of the prophets, nor help of the righteous.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:13
verses.text: There there is the sentence of corruption, the way of fire, and the path which bringeth to Gehenna.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:14
verses.text: On this account there is one law by one, one age and an end for all who are in it.

verses.name: Second Baruch 85:15
verses.text: Then He will preserve those whom He finds he may be gracious, and at the same time destroy those who are polluted with sins.]

verses.name: Second Baruch 86:1
verses.text: When therefore ye receive this my epistle, read it in your congregations with care.

verses.name: Second Baruch 86:2
verses.text: And meditate thereon, above all on the days of your fasts.

verses.name: Second Baruch 86:3
verses.text: And bear me in mind by means of this epistle, as I also bear you in mind in it, and always fare ye well.

verses.name: Second Baruch 87:1
verses.text: And it came to pass when I had ended all the words of this epistle, and had written it sedulously to its close, that I folded it, and sealed it carefully, and bound it to the neck of the eagle, and dismissed and sent it.
